vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/6600dd35-ac34-41ec-88a6-2a8e2aa830bb">YOUTH</keyword>         <topcClas>Social indicators and quality of life - Society and culture</topcClas>         <topcClas>Youth - Social stratification and groupings</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>Young People's Social Attitudes Survey, 2003 (YPSA)</i> is an offshoot of the <i>British Social Attitudes Survey, 2003 (BSA)</i> (held at the UK Data Archive (UKDA) under SN 5235). It was designed to explore the attitudes and values of children and young people and make comparisons with those held by adults in 2003 and with other young people interviewed on the 1998 and 1994 YPSA (held under SN 4231 and SN 3629 respectively). All young people aged 12-19 living in the households of BSA respondents were approached for interview.</abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The data contain 663 respondents aged 12-19 from a face-to-face interview, covering: social attitudes; gender differences; problems at school; views about education and work; politics and decision-making; prejudice and morality; fulfilment; friends and social networks; household tasks; demographic characteristics. The data may be linked via serial number to the adult in the household for the 2003 <i>British Social Attitudes Survey</i>.<br> </abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="2003-06-01T00:00:00Z">June 2003</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="2003-09-01T00:00:00Z">September 2003</collDate>         <collDate>A small number of interviews were conducted during October and November 2003.</collDate>         <nation>Great Britain</nation>         <geogUnit>Government Office Regions</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Young people</universe>         <universe>Young people aged 12-19 living in the households of BSA respondents (SN 5235).</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>Whilst this is not a regular series, a previous YPSA survey was carried out in 1998 and 1994 (see SN 4231 and SN 3629)</timeMeth>         <sampProc>Multi-stage stratified random sample</sampProc>         <deviat>997 (target)   663 (obtained)</deviat>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting variable used: YPWT. See documentation for details.</weight>         <cleanOps>A*</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Standard conditions of access</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. The depositor may be informed about usage. See <a href=http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/get-data/how-to-access/conditions.aspx>terms and conditions of access</a> for further information.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relStdy>3629 Young People's Social Attitudes, 1994 </relStdy>       <relStdy>4231 Young People's Social Attitudes, 1998 </relStdy>       <relPubl>Park, A., Phillips, M. and Johnson, M. (2004) <i>Young people in Britain: the attitudes and experiences of 12-19 year olds</i>, <a href="http://www.dfes.gov.uk/research/data/uploadfiles/RR564.pdf" title="Research Report">Research Report No. 564</a>, Department for Education and Skills.<br></relPubl>       <relPubl><li><a href="http://www.esds.ac.uk/government/citations/" title="Publications citing ESDS Government data">Search for Young People's Social Attitudes Survey in ESDS Government publication search</a>.</li><br></relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
